value: Military Trophy after Polidoro da Caravaggio

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle showing a design for a military trophy. At center, a helmet in the antique style with a feathered lion crest. Below are two large shields and clusters of spears. At right, a quiver of arrows.

Four Preliminary Designs for the Venetiones Series: Recto, above: Fishing for Tuna; Recto, below: Hunting crocodile with a Pig as Bait; Verso, above: Indians catching fish with the help of pelicans; Verso, below: Boar hunt with Shotguns;

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Obverse: Two scenes - top, Fishing. Men in open tuna fishing boats have caught fish in large nets; below, alligator hunt. Pigs used as bait. Hunters at left. Reverse: two scenes, top - fishing, using pelicans; hunters, left behind the bushes, fire at boars, right.

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle showing design for four candelabra. At left, entitled All Amore (to Love), the three graces, two cupids with bows and crossed quivers. At center left, entitled Alla Pace (to Peace), swans, a cornucopia, a trophy to Arts and Science, a group of Cupid and Psyche, a trophy of musical instruments and a caduceus. At center right, entitled Alla Guerre (to War), a monumental rostral column with a victory group. A long trophy of arms above. At right, entitled Alli Dei) (To God), lions, griffins, Genii with trumpets and an eagle.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, black chalk on light blue paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli; Rome; 1901: acquired by Museum

Putti in Four Octagons and Two Circles

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Upper row: octagons showing first putto with bow and quiver at back; second putto running with wreath; third putto dancing with bowl and pitcher; fourth putto running and carrying dish.  Bottom row: circles. At left, male putto with spear and dog. At right, putto walking and carrying quiver upon left shoulder. All representations include landscapes.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush with brown wash over black chalk with traces of graphite on off white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli; Rome; 1901: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line

Ceiling Design, History, Abundance in Six Ovals, Sala di Ercole ed Ebe, Palazzo Gessi, Faenza

label: Description
value:
Eight ovals, two rows: 1) winged female figure, in pose of History, writing upon a tablet 2) Abundance supporting cornucopia with both hands 3) Fame running with trumpet and wreath 7) Fame walking with torch in her
right hand, wreath in left  8) Fame dancing toward left, playing trumpet

Recto, above: Crane hunt using cones; Below, left: Jacob, half figure; lion with a blindfold over his head; map of a fortifications; Below right: Fox Hunt. Verso, above left: Starling Hunt; below left: Lion hunt with torches and nets; right: half figures of St. Joseph, Abraham and Isaac, and an unknown figure; inscription.

label: Description
value: Recto, top: Fowlers trapping cranes by means of bait placed in paper cones which are set into the ground. Fowlers are at left, behind a tree. Below, left: bust-length figure, inscribed above "Jacob"; right, hunters and dogs trapping a small animal in a tree. Recto: horizontally: upper left - Fowlers using birds as bait to trap other birds. Fowlers at left behind trees; lower left: Hunters driving lions into nets, rising flaming torches, right - three bust-length figures from Old Testament.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and wash on laid paper
